claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.

verified_evidence.quote: The recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4, Flublok®, Supemtek® [EU, Canada], Sanofi Pasteur) was the first licensed influenza vaccine to be produced using recombinant viral proteins instead of antigens derived from live influenza virus (as for inactivated split virion and subunit vaccines). RIV4 is an unadjuvanted vaccine containing 45 µg of HA/dose from each of the four strains.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote appears on page 2 of the document, with only minor formatting and spacing differences. The factual content is preserved: 'The recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4, Flublok®, Supemtek® [EU, Canada], Sanofi Pasteur) was the first licensed influenza vaccine to be produced using recombinant viral proteins instead of antigens derived from live influenza virus (as for inactivated split virion and subunit vaccines). RIV4 is an unadjuvanted vaccine containing 45 µg of HA/dose from each of the four strains.'. The quote directly states that RIV4 (Flublok) contains 45 µg of HA per strain, which is three times the standard 15 µg HA per strain in standard-dose flu vaccines. This substantiates the first part of the claim regarding antigen content. While the quote does not explicitly mention greater immunogenicity, the claim's first part is fully supported by the explicit numbers provided in the quote. The document elsewhere discusses immunogenicity, but for this quote, the support is for the antigen content comparison.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: The quote appears on page 2 of the document, with only minor formatting and spacing differences. The factual content is preserved: 'The recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4, Flublok®, Supemtek® [EU, Canada], Sanofi Pasteur) was the first licensed influenza vaccine to be produced using recombinant viral proteins instead of antigens derived from live influenza virus (as for inactivated split virion and subunit vaccines). RIV4 is an unadjuvanted vaccine containing 45 µg of HA/dose from each of the four strains.'
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly states that RIV4 (Flublok) contains 45 µg of HA per strain, which is three times the standard 15 µg HA per strain in standard-dose flu vaccines. This substantiates the first part of the claim regarding antigen content. While the quote does not explicitly mention greater immunogenicity, the claim's first part is fully supported by the explicit numbers provided in the quote. The document elsewhere discusses immunogenicity, but for this quote, the support is for the antigen content comparison.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote explicitly states that Flublok (RIV4) contains 45 µg of HA per strain, which is three times the standard 15 µg HA per strain in standard-dose flu vaccines, directly supporting the claim about antigen content.

verified_evidence.quote: Recently Richards et al.65 examined CD4 T-cell and antibody responses in healthy adults who received egg derived split vaccine, cell derived split vaccine or RIV4 for three successive influenza seasons (2015-2016, 2016-2017, and 2017-2018 65. RIV4 elicited the most robust responses, with significantly higher T-cell and antibody levels than the other two vaccines.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote appears on page 5 of the document, with only minor differences in formatting and punctuation. The relevant passage is: 'Recently Richards et al.65 examined CD4 T-cell and antibody responses in healthy adults who received egg derived split vaccine, cell derived split vaccine or RIV4 for three successive influenza seasons (2015-2016, 2016-2017, and 2017-2018 65. RIV4 elicited the most robust responses, with significantly higher T-cell and antibody levels than the other two vaccines.' This matches the quoted content in meaning and technical detail.. The quote directly supports the claim that Flublok (RIV4) is linked to greater immunogenicity compared to standard-dose flu vaccines. It describes a study in which RIV4 produced significantly higher T-cell and antibody responses than both egg-derived and cell-derived split vaccines over three influenza seasons. While the quote does not explicitly mention the 3x HA antigen content, it does provide direct evidence of greater immunogenicity, which is the key point of the claim.

RIV4 elicited the most robust responses, with significantly higher T-cell and antibody levels than the other two vaccines.' This matches the quoted content in meaning and technical detail.

It describes a study in which RIV4 produced significantly higher T-cell and antibody responses than both egg-derived and cell-derived split vaccines over three influenza seasons. While the quote does not explicitly mention the 3x HA antigen content, it does provide direct evidence of greater immunogenicity, which is the key point of the claim.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote describes a direct comparison in which RIV4 (Flublok) produced significantly higher immune responses than standard-dose vaccines, affirming the link between higher HA content and greater immunogenicity.

rejected_evidence.quote: Higher magnitudes of haemagglutination inhibitory antibody response against HA1 have also been observed with RIV4 compared to egg- or mammalian cell derived split vaccines (Flucelvax Tetra, Seqirus, and Fluzone quadrivalent SD, Sanofi Pasteur 60).
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote provides direct evidence that RIV4 (Flublok) elicits higher immunogenicity, as measured by haemagglutination inhibitory antibody responses, compared to standard-dose flu vaccines.

rejected_evidence.quote: Portnoff et al.64 demonstrated that recombinant HA antigens (specifically for the H3 strain) produced using BEVS (as used for RIV4), induced significantly higher levels of broadly cross reactive antibodies against highly conserved regions of the HA head and stem domains than egg derived split vaccines 64.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote references a study showing that the recombinant HA in RIV4 induces higher levels of cross-reactive antibodies than standard egg-derived split vaccines, supporting the claim of greater immunogenicity.
